Wisdom: الْخَوْفُ سِجْنُ النَّفْسِ عَنِ الذُّنُوبِ وَرَادِعُهَا عَنِ الْمَعَاصِي
enWisdom: Fear [of Allah] is the imprisonment of the self from sins and its impediment from vices
Fear [Allah] and you will be feared by the people
Fear [Allah] and you will be feared; and do not act jokingly such that you are belittled
When you fear the Creator, you flee towards Him

Wisdom: خَفْ رَبَّكَ وَارْجُ رَحْمَتَهُ يُؤْمِنْكَ مِمَّا تَخَافُ وَيُنِلْكَ مَا رَجَوْتَ
enWisdom: Fear your Lord and seek His mercy, He will save you from that which you fear [in this world] and will bestow [upon you] what you hope for

Wisdom: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ تَقِيَّةَ مَنْ سَمِعَ فَخَشَعَ وَاقْتَرَفَ فَاعْتَرَفَ وَوَجِلَ فَعَمِلَ وَحَاذَرَ فَبَادَرَ
enWisdom: So be wary of [your duty towards] Allah with the God-wariness of one who listens hence humbles himself, who commits [a sin] hence he confesses, who becomes afraid hence he performs virtuous acts and is cautious hence he hastens [towards good deeds]
One who fears [Allah] gets up [to worship Him] in the night
One whose fear [of Allah] increases, his affliction is reduced

Wisdom: مَنْ خَافَ اللَّهَ لَمْ يَشْفِ غَيْظَهُ
enWisdom: One who fears Allah does not quench his anger [by taking revenge]
One whose heart submits, his limbs [also] submit

Wisdom: مَنْ خَافَ رَبَّهُ كَفَّ عَنْ ظُلْمِهِ
enWisdom: One who fears his Lord refrains from being unjust [to anyone]
One whose fear [of Allah] reduces, his affliction increases
The best barrier from sins is fear [of Allah]
